column1: # New Localizations for the post 0.7 buildings, for Dwarves

column2: The Dwarves are master Masons, and given time, can build fortifications upon which armies break like water.
Keeps, gives levy and garrison size
A place to train, with axes or otherwise, is needed to supply skilled troops.
The Small Dwelling Galleries of this fortress provide housing to some families of soldiers.
column3: Les Petites galeries d'habitations de la forteresse apporte logement à certaines familles des soldats.

column2: The Large Dwelling Galleries of the fortress provide housing to all the families of soldiers.
column3: Les Grandes Galeries d'habitations de la forteresse apporte logement aux familles des soldats.

column2: The Halls of the fortress provides housing to some merchants.
column3: Les Salles de la forteresse apporte un espace pour quelques marchands.

column2: The Dwelling Halls of the fortress provides more space for merchants, and for some rich families.
column3: Les Salles de la forteresse apportent plus d'espace pour les marchants, mais aussi pour quelques familles aisées.

column2: The Large Dwelling Halls of the fortress provides more space to merchants, artisans, and for some rich families.
column3: Les Larges Salles de la forteresse apportent plus d'espaces pour les marchants, les artisans, et pour de nombreuses riches familles.

column2: The Dwarven Dwelling Halls of the Fortress, finely chiseled in stone, are the wonder of your territory. Many merchants come from all dwarves territories to sell their products, and many noble families settled there. The best dwarven craftsmen participated in the creation of this place.
column3: Les Salles Naines de la Forteresse, finement ciselées dans la pierre, sont la merveille de votre territoire. De nombreux marchants viennent de tout les territoires nains pour y vendre leurs produits, et de nombreuses familles nobles s'y sont installées. Les meilleurs artisans nains ont participé à la création de cet endroit.

column2: Dwarves generally dislike bodies of water, so unlike solid rock. But they admit that boats are useful.
Dwarves revere their ancestors, and will use a bare room to respect them if nothing better is available.
Dwarves revere their ancestors, and will set aside areas well decorated with statues and carved murals, in which to respect them.
The Dwarves are the children of Aule, the Smith. To a proper Dwarf, Forges are as necessary as beds.
Only in Khazad-dûm can one build the special Forges for Mithril, the greatest of metals.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled soldiers, for Longbeards or Ironfists.
The Longbeards have some of most experienced Dwarven soldiers, thanks to their longer lives
The Ironfist Dwarves have taken to specializing with Pikes.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled soldiers, for Broadbeams, Firebeards, or Petty Dwarves.
The Dwarves of the Blue Mountains frequently patrol nearby Western Eraidor to prevent Evil from settling there.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled pike-soldiers, for Stonefoots, Blacklocks, and Stiffbeards.

column1: # Added post 0.8 to replace Stiffbeard/Blacklock/Stonefoot elite cavalry

column2: Being surrounded by plains and deserts, the Dwarves of the south-east normally use pikes. However, deciplined Heavy Infantry is sometimes needed, and that is where the Southern Axe-Dwarves come in.
This Dike is an embarrasment to Dwarves, but it is better than nothing.
A rough stone wall protects the Delving entrance.
The entrances of this Delving are properly built, but small.
Sophisticated, well-built stoneworks fortify the entrances of this Delving.
The massive, perfectly crafted stone fortifications of this Delving are almost invincible.
Enhanced with carved Runes, Armies break on these fortifications like water.
Keeps, gives levy and garrison size
A chamber has been set aside for buying and selling goods and wares.
A series of chambers have been assigned to Merchants and Crafts-Dwarves.
The Delving has a small gallery with chambers for buying and selling.
With multiple chambers and a sizable gallery, this delving Market is is a moneymaker..
With multiple galleries and many chambers, this delvings Market is everything a Dwarf feels it should be.
The size and activity of this marketplace is known as far as the eastern sea.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled soldiers, for Longbeards or Ironfists.
The Longbeards have some of most experienced Dwarven soldiers, thanks to their longer lives
The Ironfist Dwarves have taken to specializing with Pikes.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled soldiers, for Broadbeams, Firebeards, or Petty Dwarves.
The Dwarves of the Blue Mountains frequently patrol nearby Western Eraidor to prevent Evil from settling there.
Here, records and lore are stored.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled pike-soldiers, for Stonefoots, Blacklocks, and Stiffbeards.

column1: # Added post 0.8 to replace Stiffbeard/Blacklock/Stonefoot elite cavalry

column2: Being surrounded by plains and deserts, the Dwarves of the south-east normally use pikes. However, deciplined Heavy Infantry is sometimes needed, and that is where the Southern Axe-Dwarves come in.
Khazad-dûm, the most powerful city of the dwarves, offers protection, wealth and glory to its owner.
A wealthy dwarf kingdom, built under the Lonely Mountain.
Although lesser than Khazad-dûm or Erebor, the great halls of the Iron Hills Dwarves are nevertheless imposing.
Although lesser than Khazad-dûm or Erebor, the great halls of the Blacklock Dwarves are nevertheless imposing
Although lesser than the lost city of Nogrod, the great halls of the Firebeard Dwarves are nevertheless imposing.
Although lesser than the lost city of Belegost, the great halls of the Broadbeam Dwarves are nevertheless imposing.
Although lesser than Khazad-dûm or Erebor, the great halls of the Stiffbeard Dwarves are nevertheless imposing.
Thráin II was granted lands in the Ered Luin by the Broadbeams, and until the recorvery of Erebor, it was the Longbeard capitol.
Although lesser than Khazad-dûm or Erebor, the great halls of the Stonefoot Dwarves are nevertheless imposing.
The Dwarven Halls of Aglarond were founded by Gimli, early in the Fourth Age, and are wonderous in their beauty.
While the Grey Mountains had long been Longbeard territory, it flourished after the fall of Khazad-dûm, reaching a peak under Dàin I, before the abrupt coming of the dragons.

Durin the Deathless, eldest of the Fathers of the Dwarves, first awoke under Mount Gunadabad, and ever since then it has been a holy mountain to the Dwarves. In the first age, it even served as a Dwarven Capitol.
As a neutral Dwarven Capitol, Gundabad has mighty halls where an Assembly of all Dwarves can meet, and decide common Dwarven policies.
As a Dwarven Capitol, Gundabad needs an established honour gurad.
The common lore of all Dwarves is kept here.
According to the Dwarves of Durin's Folk, it was built on the site where Durin the Deathless looked down in the lake and saw a crown above his head
column3: its purpose was to mark the event. It was ornamented with Ancient Dwarvish runes. By the late Third Age the stone was broken, cracked and heavily weathered

column2: According to the Dwarves of Durin's folk, after Durin the Deathless had awoken at Mount Gundabad in the far north of the Misty Mountains, he travelled south until he came upon this lake. He looked down into it and saw a crown above his head, a reflection of stars above, despite the fact it was day and the stars were visible. Taking the crown as a sign, he founded the great city of Khazad-dûm beneath the mountains that fed Kheled-zâram.
An isolated peak, with unknown treasures
An isolated peak, with unknown treasures
A natural cavern system of astonishing natural beauty
Temple Complexes need protection too. The Dwarves are master Masons, and given time, can build fortifications upon which armies break like water.
Here, Dwarven ascetics lead a life of hard work and prayer, trying to be free from greed and anger.
Quarters of Barracks for skilled soldiers.
The Forge Guards are the elite Dwarven infantry associated with Sacred Halls and their Great Forge of Aulë.
The Dwelling Galleries of Sacred Halls start with families of priests and servants, but often grow into mighy Halls
Aulë, the maker of the Dwarves, is a crafter, and for Dwarves crafting is a form of worship.
